dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Trump's defense of that caravan in Portland is just... I mean, calling paintballs "not bullets" when they're shooting at people? That's a pretty wild take.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Trump's defense of that caravan in Portland is just... I mean, calling paintballs not bullets when they're shooting at people? That's a pretty wild take.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But given the opportunity to denounce a caravan of his supporters in Portland, who were caught on video Saturday shooting protesters with paintballs or tear gas, Trump called it a peaceful protest and declared paint is not bullets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But you have to admit, Biden's initial statement didn't specifically call out Antifa, which is a huge part of the problem here. Trump pointed that out, and it's a valid criticism.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But you have to admit, Biden's initial statement didn't specifically call out Antifa, which is a huge part of the problem here. Trump pointed that out, and it's a valid criticism.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That sentiment was echoed by Trump, who spent much of his White House briefing taking shots at Democrats, claiming Biden didnt mention the far-left and accusing him of repeating the monstrous lie that these are peaceful protests. He mentioned law enforcement, but he didnt mention Antifa, I wonder why, Trump added, claiming Biden would give the decentralized anarchist group the far-left policy agenda its asking for.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Valid? Biden condemned violence on both sides, though. He said rioting isn't protesting—that's a blanket statement. Why does he need to name every group?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Valid? Biden condemned violence on both sides, though. He said rioting isn't protesting-that's a blanket statement. Why does he need to name every group?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Biden offered a stern condemnation of protest violence in his speech, declaring rioting is not protesting after unequivocally denouncing violence on the left and right and calling on Trump to do the same in a statement on Sunday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Because context matters! Antifa's been central to a lot of this unrest. By not naming them, it feels like he's avoiding the elephant in the room. Trump's not wrong to highlight that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because context matters! Antifa's been central to a lot of this unrest. By not naming them, it feels like he's avoiding the elephant in the room. Trump's not wrong to highlight that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but then Trump turns around and calls Kyle Rittenhouse's situation "interesting"? A teenager with an AR-15, two people dead—that's more than interesting, it's a tragedy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, but then Trump turns around and calls Kyle Rittenhouse's situation interesting? A teenager with an ARminus fifteen, two people dead-that's more than interesting, it's a tragedy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Asked about Rittenhouse, Trump called it an interesting situation, and claimed Rittenhouse was trying to get away from protesters who violently attacked him, asserting, without evidence, that Rittenhouse probably would've been killed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, Trump did say Rittenhouse was trying to get away from attackers. Whether you agree or not, he's framing it as self-defense. It's messy, but he's not endorsing murder.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, Trump did say Rittenhouse was trying to get away from attackers. Whether you agree or not, he's framing it as self-defense. It's messy, but he's not endorsing murder.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Asked about Rittenhouse, Trump called it an interesting situation, and claimed Rittenhouse was trying to get away from protesters who violently attacked him, asserting, without evidence, that Rittenhouse probably would've been killed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Framing it without evidence, though! And then there's the whole "Biden is a radical" thing—Biden literally said, "Do I look like a socialist with a soft spot for rioters?" He's pushing back hard.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Framing it without evidence, though! And then there's the whole Biden is a radical thing-Biden literally said, Do I look like a socialist with a soft spot for rioters? He's pushing back hard.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ask yourself: Do I look to you like a radical socialist with a soft spot for rioters? Really? Biden asked during his speech, in contrast with Trumps claim that he would surrender to the left wing mob.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but that's political theater. Meanwhile, Trump's going to Kenosha tomorrow despite the governor asking him not to. He says it could increase "love and respect for the country." You think that's tone-deaf?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but that's political theater. Meanwhile, Trump's going to Kenosha tomorrow despite the governor asking him not to. He says it could increase love and respect for the country. You think that's tone-deaf?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump is slated to travel to Kenosha on Tuesday to survey the damage from the protests, despite Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers urging him not to. Should be very interesting, Trump said of the visit, predicting It could increase enthusiasm, it could increase love and respect for our country, after he was asked about concerns it could increase violence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I think it's risky. After all this, showing up could inflame tensions, not calm them. And his campaign calling Biden weak for not repudiating supporters? Pot, kettle.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I think it's risky. After all this, showing up could inflame tensions, not calm them. And his campaign calling Biden weak for not repudiating supporters? Pot, kettle.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Biden campaign released a statement calling Trump too weak, too scared, to repudiate one of his supporters.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Maybe, but Trump's base sees it as him standing with law and order. And let's be real, both sides are playing to their audiences here. It's all about who controls the narrative.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Maybe, but Trump's base sees it as him standing with law and order. And let's be real, both sides are playing to their audiences here. It's all about who controls the narrative.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: True, but one narrative involves dismissing actual violence from his own side. "Paint is not bullets" is gonna haunt him if things escalate further.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but one narrative involves dismissing actual violence from his own side. Paint is not bullets is gonna haunt him if things escalate further.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But given the opportunity to denounce a caravan of his supporters in Portland, who were caught on video Saturday shooting protesters with paintballs or tear gas, Trump called it a peaceful protest and declared paint is not bullets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Fair point. It's also wild how personal this got—Biden bringing up his heart, his family's story. He's really trying to contrast character here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fair point. It's also wild how personal this got-Biden bringing up his heart, his family's story. He's really trying to contrast character here.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You know me. You know my heart, and you know my story, my familys story. Ask yourself: Do I look to you like a radical socialist with a soft spot for rioters?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Trump's just... doubling down. This is not gonna de-escalate before November, that's for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Trump's just... doubling down. This is not gonna de-escalate before November, that's for sure.
